title: Python Tools Extension: Worker + Runtime + Publish (Option B)
description: Ship Python Tools as an installable, signed RZN extension bundle (plugin ZIP) that can be published from this repo and installed into rznapp via the backend-signed catalog (Option B). See docs/PYTHON_TOOLS_EXTENSION_PACKAGING.md for the full plan.

title: Move rzn-python-worker source out of rznapp
description: Extract the python MCP worker (rzn-python-worker) out of the desktop host repo so authors can build python-tools without cloning rznapp. The worker should depend on pysandbox for secure mode and support YOLO mode via config.
acceptance_criteria:
- rzn-python-worker can be built from this repo (or a sibling repo under /Users/sarav/Downloads/side/rzn/).
- rznapp no longer needs to contain python worker source code to install/run python-tools.
- Build produces a runnable MCP stdio worker binary (macOS universal first).
close_reason: Implemented rzn-python-worker MCP stdio sidecar in pysandbox-rs with bundled/system Python selection and policy-driven sandbox selection.

title: Build signed python-tools bundle ZIP (macos_universal)
description: Add build tooling in this repo (or sibling) to package the python-tools extension ZIP with deterministic plugin.json signing, and include the python runtime payload as documented in docs/PYTHON_TOOLS_EXTENSION_PACKAGING.md.
acceptance_criteria:
- Running a single build command produces python-tools-<version>-macos_universal.zip.
- ZIP contains plugin.json + plugin.sig + worker binary + python runtime payload.
- rznapp can install the ZIP via Extensions -> Install from fileâ€¦ and run rzn.worker.health + example.echo.
close_reason: Added deterministic plugin bundling + signing scripts and python-tools config; produces signed ZIP with worker + bundled Python runtime.

title: CI: Upload python-tools ZIP to R2 and register release in backend
description: Wire CI publishing: upload immutable ZIP artifacts to R2 and call backend admin API to register releases (Option B). Backend will publish a signed catalog consumed by rznapp.
acceptance_criteria:
- CI uploads artifact ZIP to R2 under plugins/artifacts/python-tools/... (immutable key).
- CI computes sha256 and calls backend admin endpoint to register release.
- A backend publish run includes the release in the signed catalog.
notes: Blocked on backend-6d2.2 (register release) + backend-6d2.3 (publish catalog). Local install-from-file loop is implemented.

title: Docs + runbook: local smoke (install-from-file + Try It)
description: Write a crisp runbook proving the end-to-end loop: build zip -> install into rznapp -> run Try It scripts -> see stdout/stderr + exported artifacts.
acceptance_criteria:
- A new dev can build the ZIP, install it into rznapp, and run a sample script end-to-end in < 10 minutes.
- Doc includes expected output and where to find logs/artifacts.
close_reason: Added local build/install-from-file runbook and smoke script.
